pullRequest.body: I propose we turn this on, and see if it works. Once it does, we then remove the lean4checker step from regular CI.

nodes.body:
~~Should it install lean/download Mathlib before getting the cache?~~
Nevermind, I see that there is a `checkout` step: not sure how I missed it earlier.

EDIT: I actually think that this is indeed missing.  I am testing a run of `lean4checker` without the `cron` command, and, if successful, I will push here a version that builds.

I have now waited a whole 24 hours and I think that the cron job did not run, right?

As for more testing, when I had CI active `on: push`, it reported success, but did not report failure.  I do not know what it is, since it first reported suspect that it is because once lean4checker fail.  I realize now that it reported on the `failure` stream and that step of CI is the one that I removed.

I am going to reinstate the posting of both failure messages, but the cron job seems to still be missing.
@adomani, cron jobs do not run on PRs. They have to be tested in production. :-)
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9036801665/job/24834462266)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9036801665/job/24834461833)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9036801665/job/24834462551)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: add CI job to run lean4checker periodically

source.title: chore: run shake periodically, and post if something goes wrong
